layerItems.description:
OpenEmbedded-Core is a layer containing the core metadata for current versions
of OpenEmbedded. It is distro-less (can build a functional image with
DISTRO = "nodistro") and contains only emulated machine support.
layerItems.name: openembedded-core

layerItems.description:
This layer contains the metadata necessary to build the klibc library and
utilities (shared and static) plus other tools useful for the creation of
small-sized initramfs.
layerItems.name: meta-initramfs
layerItems.summary: klibc library and related utilities for building an initramfs

layerItems.description: The XFCE Desktop software and related components.
layerItems.name: meta-xfce

layerItems.description: Additional shared OE metadata
layerItems.name: meta-oe

layerItems.description: Filesystem related libraries and programs.  Includes support for FUSE and related components.
layerItems.name: meta-filesystems

layerItems.description:
This layer provides support for building web servers, web-based
applications and related software.
layerItems.name: meta-webserver
layerItems.summary: Web server software and web-based applications

layerItems.description:
This layer is intended to be a central point for networking-related
packages and configuration.  It should be useful directly on top of
oe-core and compliments meta-openembedded.  It should be primarily useful
to the following groups:
layerItems.name: meta-networking

layerItems.description: PYTHON Language related items
layerItems.name: meta-python

layerItems.description: PERL language and related items
layerItems.name: meta-perl

layerItems.description: GNOME desktop environment components
layerItems.name: meta-gnome

layerItems.description: Multimedia related components such as gstreamer, alsa, dvb, etc.
layerItems.name: meta-multimedia

layerItems.description:
This layer provides security tools, hardening tools for Linux kernels
and libraries for implementing security mechanisms.
layerItems.name: meta-security

layerItems.description: This layer's purpose is enabling SE Linux support when used with Poky.
layerItems.name: meta-selinux

layerItems.description:
This layer provides lxc package build for Wind River Linux.  It
is required by most other layers that Wind River provides.
layerItems.name: meta-virtualization

layerItems.description:
This layer is intended to be a central point for realtime related kernel and
system development. It also contains utilities, and configuration useful for
tuning a realtime system. It should be useful directly on top of oe-core.  It
should be primarily useful to the following groups:
layerItems.name: meta-realtime

layerItems.description:
This layer provides the Wind River Linux distribution definitions, 
distribution-specific integration and bug fixes, and other wrlinux components.
layerItems.name: wrlinux

layerItems.description:
This layer provides template processing support to OpenEmbedded.  Wind River
templates are a mechanism that permit various configurations to be enabled
with a simple setting.
layerItems.name: wr-template

layerItems.description: Support for building the packages from the OpenStack project.  It includes recipes for nova, glance, keystone, cinder, quantum, swift and horizon components.
layerItems.name: meta-openstack
layerItems.summary: Support for building the packages from the OpenStack project

layerItems.description: The base distribution settings for wrlinux and related DISTRO items.
layerItems.name: wrlinux-distro
layerItems.summary: Wind River Linux base distribution layer

layerItems.description: Carrier Grade Linux related components
layerItems.name: meta-cgl-common

layerItems.description: This layer is derived from the Wind River Linux Carrier Grade Profile and contains the images and recipes required to build images related to Carrier Grade Linux.
layerItems.name: wrlinux-cgl

recipes.description: The gen-coredump package contains a gen_coredump program

SAF Test is an open-source project serving as the 	central location for developing and providing 	conformance test suites for SA Forum published 	specifications. The test suites cover both the 	A and B version of the HPI and AIS specifications.	Currently HPI conformance testsuite has been 	integrated.
The cyclictest package contains a Hello World program
The ipsec-test package contains a ipsec-test World program
Based on Linux container and underlying namespace, vrf package provides a framework to make easier to establish virtual router/switch with WRLinux

Monit is a free open source utility for managing and monitoring, processes, programs, files, directories and filesystems on a UNIX system. Monit conducts automatic maintenance and repair and can execute meaningful causal actions in error situations.
recipes.inherits: autotools autotools-brokensep siteconfig siteinfo systemd update-rc.d
recipes.summary: Monit is a tool used for system monitoring and error recovery

recipes.description: UMIP is an open source implementation of Mobile IPv6 and NEMO Basic Support for Linux. It is released under the GPLv2 license. It supports the following IETF RFC: RFC6275 (Mobile IPv6), RFC3963 (NEMO), RFC3776 and RFC4877 (IPsec and IKEv2).
recipes.inherits: autotools autotools-brokensep siteconfig siteinfo systemd update-rc.d
recipes.summary: Mobile IPv6 and NEMO for Linux

recipes.description: Wind River Linux core package group: cgl testing
Wind River Linux core package group: networking
Wind River Linux core package group: cgl
An image which approximates WRLinux std without graphics.
recipes.inherits: core-image image image-artifact-names image-postinst-intercepts image_types image_types_wic kernel-arch license_image meta populate_sdk_base populate_sdk_ext qemuboot rootfs-postcommands rootfs_ipk siteinfo wrlinux-image wrltemplate_image

wrtemplates.description: Enable the various CGL protocol templates
wrtemplates.name: feature/protocols
